info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:03AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN FRANKLIN...CENTRAL CRAWFORD AND NORTHEASTERN SEBASTIAN COUNTIES... At 602 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles west of Ozark to 4 miles north of Charleston to near Lavaca, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Van Buren... Ozark... Charleston... Mountainburg... Alma... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Chester... Rudy... Bloomer... Lake Fort Smith... Fern... Kibler... Concord... Jethro... Shibley... Locke... Vesta... Cecil... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 5 and 36. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 34. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
